body: what exact error did you get?

If I want to train it with gpt2, I think the only parameter I should set is --model_checkpoint="gpt2", and first is there is no set_num_special_tokens method in modeling_gpt2, and I replaced it with set_tied() in train.py, but I got some type errors.

TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'log_dir'

I did install all the requirements and I use pytorch = 0.4.1, thanks for your explanation.

Oh yes you are right, gpt2 depend on a PR of pytorch-pretrained-bert (https://github.com/huggingface/pytorch-pretrained-BERT/pull/597) which is not merged and released yet. I have to finish cleaning up the test for it.

If you want to use it in the meantime you can install pytorch-pretrained-bert from source like this:
```bash
pip uninstall pytorch-pretrained-BERT
git clone https://github.com/huggingface/pytorch-pretrained-BERT.git
cd pytorch-pretrained-BERT
git checkout attention
pip install -e .
```

It should work
This problems occurs for both gpt2 and openai-gpt. I did checkout to attention branch but I'm still obtatining similar problem:(

> Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./train.py", line 250, in <module>
    train()
  File "./train.py", line 229, in train
    tb_logger = TensorboardLogger(log_dir=None)
  File "/home/dial/pfb30/scripts/poly/env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/ignite/contrib/handlers/tensorboard_logger.py", line 355, in __init__
    self.writer = SummaryWriter(log_dir=log_dir)
  File "/home/dial/pfb30/scripts/poly/env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorboardX/writer.py", line 254, in __init__
    self._get_file_writer()
  File "/home/dial/pfb30/scripts/poly/env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tensorboardX/writer.py", line 310, in _get_file_writer
    self.file_writer = FileWriter(logdir=self.logdir, **self.kwargs)
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'log_dir'

You should update to the latest version of pytorch ignite (this change to tensorboardX was included [here](https://github.com/pytorch/ignite/blob/58a8f40bc2a2870c402a44c194829e904fc1133e/ignite/contrib/handlers/tensorboard_logger.py#L408))

> You should update to the latest version of pytorch ignite (this change to tensorboardX was included [here](https://github.com/pytorch/ignite/blob/58a8f40bc2a2870c402a44c194829e904fc1133e/ignite/contrib/handlers/tensorboard_logger.py#L408))

I have the latest version of ignite (verified by trying to pip install it again on my Amazon Deep Learning AMI EC2 instance after doing `source activate pytorch_p36`). I still get the same error that @budzianowski is referring to.
Created an issue in the Ignite repo, it looks like we need to downgrade from tensorboardX 1.7 or install the latest ignite from master: https://github.com/pytorch/ignite/issues/534

@thomwolf in train.py, you'll have to change all references to `tb_logger.writer.log_dir` to `tb_logger.writer.logdir`. This is because in the latest version of tensorboardX (not in PyPI, in GitHub master branch), they've renamed `log_dir` to `logdir`.
Thanks for help, now it's up and running for me talking nicely!

> Oh yes you are right, gpt2 depend on a PR of pytorch-pretrained-bert ([huggingface/pytorch-pretrained-BERT#597](https://github.com/huggingface/pytorch-pretrained-BERT/pull/597)) which is not merged and released yet. I have to finish cleaning up the test for it.
> 
> If you want to use it in the meantime you can install pytorch-pretrained-bert from source like this:
> 
> ```shell
> pip uninstall pytorch-pretrained-BERT
> git clone https://github.com/huggingface/pytorch-pretrained-BERT.git
> cd pytorch-pretrained-BERT
> git checkout attention
> pip install -e .
> ```
> 
> It should work

@thomwolf can you merge to master from the attention branch and release this if it hasn't already been done yet? Thanks!
